cntk.io package¶

Module contents¶

class Deserializer(type)[source]¶

Bases: dict

Base deserializer class that can be used in the :class:ReaderConfig.

Parameters:type (str) – type of the deserializer
class ImageDeserializer(filename)[source]¶

Bases: cntk.io.Deserializer

This class configures the image reader that reads images and corresponding labels from a file of the form

```
<full path to image><tab><numerical label (0-based class id)>

```

Parameters:filename (str) – file name of the map file that associates images to classes

See also

https://github.com/microsoft/cntk/wiki/Understanding-and-Extending-Readers

static crop(crop_type='center', ratio=1.0, jitter_type='uniRatio')[source]¶

Crop transform that can be used to pass to map_features

Parameters:
  • crop_type (str, default ‘center’) – ‘center’ or ‘random’
  • ratio (float, default 1.0) – crop ratio
  • jitter_type (str, default ‘uniRatio’) – possible values are ‘None’, ‘UniRatio’, ‘UniLength’, and ‘UniArea’
Returns:

dict describing the crop transform
map_features(node, transforms)[source]¶

Maps feature node (either node instance or node name) to the transforms that will be applied to the images.

Parameters:
  • node (str or input node) – node or its name
  • transforms (list of transforms) – the transforms can be created by the static methods crop, scale, or mean.
map_labels(node, num_classes)[source]¶

Maps label node (either node instance or node name) that will be applied to the images.

Parameters:
  • node (str or input node) – node or its name
  • num_classes (int) – number of classes
static mean(filename)[source]¶

Mean transform that can be used to pass to map_features

Parameters:filename (str) – file that stores the mean values for each pixel in OpenCV matrix XML format
Returns:dict describing the mean transform
static scale(width, height, channels, interpolations='linear')[source]¶

Scale transform that can be used to pass to map_features

Parameters:
  • width (int) – width of the image in pixels
  • height (int) – height of the image in pixels
  • channels (int) – channels of the image
  • interpolations (str, default ‘linear’) – possible values are ‘nearest’, ‘linear’, ‘cubic’, and ‘lanczos’
Returns:

dict describing the scale transform
class MinibatchData[source]¶

Bases: cntk.cntk_py.MinibatchData

Holds the minibatch data of an input.

This is never directly created, but only returned by :class:MinibatchSource instances.

data()[source]¶

Returns the Value object of the minibatch.

num_samples()[source]¶

Returns the number of samples in this minibatch

num_sequences()[source]¶

Returns the number of sequences in this minibatch

class MinibatchSource(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: cntk.cntk_py.MinibatchSource

Parent class of all minibatch sources. For most cases you will need the helper functions :func:cntk.io.text_format_minibatch_source or :func:cntk.io.create_minibatch_source. A MinibatchSource can be indexed by a StreamInfo, which will return a MinibatchData object that can be passed e.g. to the :func:Trainer.train_minibatch() function.

get_next_minibatch(minibatch_size_in_samples, minibatch_size_in_sequences=None, device=None)[source]¶

Reads a minibatch that contains data for all input streams. The minibatch size is specified terms of #samples and/or #sequences for the primary input stream; value of 0 for #samples/#sequences means unspecified. In case the size is specified in terms of both #sequences and #samples, the smaller of the 2 is taken. An empty map is returned when the MinibatchSource has no more data to return.’‘

Parameters:
  • minibatch_size_in_samples (int) – number of samples to retrieve for the next minibatch. Must be > 0.
  • minibatch_size_in_sequences (int, defaults to None) – number of samples to retrieve for the next minibatch. Must be > 0.
  • device (DeviceDescriptor, defaults to None) – CNTK DeviceDescriptor
Returns:

:class:MinibatchData
stream_info(name)[source]¶

Gets the description of the stream with given name. Throws an exception of there are none or multiple streams with this same name.

stream_infos()[source]¶

Describes the stream that this source produces.

Returns:dict mapping input names to the stream information
class ReaderConfig(deserializers=None, randomize=True, epoch_size=18446744073709551615)[source]¶

Bases: dict

Reader configuration.

Parameters:
  • deserializers ('list', default is empty) – list of deserializers (:class:cntk.io.ImageDeserializer for now).
  • randomize (bool, default True) – randomize images before every epoch
  • epoch_size (int) – epoch size
minibatch_source()[source]¶

Creates an instance of :class:cntk.io.MinibatchSource from this instance, which can be used to feed data into the eval() methods of the graph nodes or the train_minibatch() of :class:cntk.Trainer.

Returns:instance of :class:cntk.io.MinibatchSource
class StreamConfiguration(name, dim, is_sparse=False, stream_alias='')[source]¶

Bases: cntk.cntk_py.StreamConfiguration

Configuration of a stream in a text format reader. This can be used :func:cntk.io.text_format_minibatch_source.

Parameters:
  • name (str) – name of this stream
  • dim (int) – dimensions of this stream. A text format reader reads data
  • flat arrays. If you need different shapes you can (as) –

:param :func:cntk.ops.reshape it later.: :param is_sparse: whether the provided data is sparse

(False by default)
Parameters:stream_alias (str, default ‘’) – name of the stream in the file that is fed to the :func:cntk.io.text_format_minibatch_source
minibatch_source(config)[source]¶

Instantiate the CNTK built-in composite minibatch source which is used to stream data into the network. :param config: a dictionary containing all the key-value configuration entries. :type config: dict

Returns:cntk.io.MinibatchSource
text_format_minibatch_source(path, stream_configs, epoch_size=18446744073709551615, randomize=True)[source]¶

Creates a minibatch source from a CNTKTextFormatReader file.

Parameters:
  • path ('file') – filename of the data file
  • stream_configs (list of :class:StreamConfiguration instances) – list of stream configurations, each of which describes one stream in the file
  • epoch_size (int, optional) – size of an epoch. In case of 0 the size of the training set will be taken. Default is max of 64bit.
  • randomize (bool, optional) – whether to randomize the contents of data file.
Returns:

class:cntk.io.MinibatchSource’
Return type:

`
